question: Hangman's fracture is -
exp: Ans. is 'b' i. e., Fracture dislocation of C, Eponym. Injury of Spine. Burst fracture. Comminuted fracture of the vertebral body. Chance fracture (Car seat belt injury)A horizontal fracture of the vertebra extending from body to the posterior element, caused by a strong distraction force. Clay-Shoveller fracture. An avulsion fracture of spinous process of the lower cervical or upper thoracic vertebrae. Hangman's fractureA fracture through the pedicle and lamina of C, vertebra, with subluxation of C, over C.-caused by hanging. Jafferson fracture. Burst fracture of atlas vertebra.
